Two Stars
Still Mine
Drama, International, Gentle, Touching
["James Cromwell gives a tour de force performance in 'Still Mine,' a deeply moving love story about a couple in their twilight years. When Craig sets out to build a more suitable house for his ailing wife Irene, he is blindsided by the bureaucratic codes and officials. As Irene becomes increasingly ill, Craig takes a final stance against all odds to finish the house, in a truly inspirational story."]

**User Summary:**

The user continues to prioritize heartfelt narratives and emotional depth in storytelling while exhibiting an evolving taste in their viewing preferences. Their average rating has stabilized at 3.9, indicating a discerning approach where coherence and engaging plots are increasingly important. A notable shift is evident following a negative reaction to previous films deemed overly depressing, which has led to a stronger intolerance for overwhelming narratives.

Recently, the user rated a film highly, commending its well-researched storytelling and superb performances, reinforcing their demand for originality and substantial storytelling that resonates emotionally. This recent interaction reflects their appreciation for enjoyable narratives that still carry emotional weight but are balanced with engaging plots.

The user values mainstream cinema and notable performances while raising their standards for meaningful narratives. Their growing critical stance emphasizes a desire for enriching media that fosters deep emotional connections. The latest rating of a fun story suggests that the user is also open to lighter narratives, provided they still deliver quality and coherence. Overall, they are moving toward a refined selection that merges emotional resonance with narrative clarity, demonstrating flexibility in their preferences while maintaining a focus on impactful storytelling.
